WARNING
=======

**ADDING CERTIFICATES GENERATED BY THIS SCRIPT TO YOU TRUST STORE MAY MESS UP YOUR TRUSTED STORE.**

**THIS IS A RESEARCH QUALITY SCRIPT, CREATED FOR RESEARCH PURPOSES. DO NOT USE IN PRODUCTION SYSETMS.**

*YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!*

About
=====

Clones a certificate chain. The top of the chain will be self-signed (promoted to root CA if not already). Obviously browsers won't trust this because the root CA will not be in their trust store.

Serial numbers of all but the leaf certificate will be changed.

Usage
=====

1. Visit the site you want to clonen the certificates for in Firefox. View the certificate and save the full chain to a pem file
2. Run `./clone-cert-chain.py legitimate-chain.pem cloned.pem` to generate a pem file containing the server's private key and the certificate chain
3. Profit 

Example diff of clones vs originals
===================================

Server
------
(Some CRL related extensions, Public Key, Signature)
```

Root
----
(Serial Number, Public Key, Signature Algorithm, Signature)
```
$ diff -u <(openssl x509 -noout -text -in legitimate-root.pem) <(openssl x509 -noout -text -in cloned-root.pem)
